posts.post_content:
Imagine this...  
Blow up Jace to use his ultimate.  
Search opponents deck for Armada Wurm / Avacyn / etc.  
Search your own deck for another copy of Jace, Architect of Thought to replace the one you just blew up.  
Put both into play.  
  
The best part is you get to use another PW ability on the one you put into play, so his ability only cost -4, your up by your opponents biggest card, and you get to use two PW abilities in one turn.  
  
Oh his other abilities are pretty nice too. This guy should not be underestimated.

Oh his other abilities are pretty nice too. This guy should not be underestimated.

posts.post_content:
His +1 is [cumber stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cumber stone).   
His -2 is essentially a weaker [Fact or Fiction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fact or Fiction).  
I can't put my finger on his ultimate, but I'm pretty sure there's a card like it.   
  
I'm not a big fan of him right now, but he could really surprise me. Tokens and small attacking thingy's were popular in Innistrad, and burn seems to have lost a lot of its touch in this block.   
  
I'm selling mine right away when I get it, mind you.

Posted By: SyntheticDreamer (9/25/2012 8:27:15 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Started out at $25, dropped to $15 a week before prerelease. Was hoping I'd be able to trade into a playset at $12 or so before people realized that digging you 6 cards turn 5 is good. Stupid Star City Games for figuring out he's damn solid and telling everyone. Back up to $30...  
  
Fun times running this guy with [Tamiyo, the Moon Sage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tamiyo, the Moon Sage). The obvious thing would be to turn 4 Jace turn 5 Tamiyo, but better than that seems to be turn 5 Tamiyo, turn 6 Jace. You've tapped their biggest guys down, all their little guys get -1/-0, Tamiyo is rolling up, Jace is rolling up, and if they swing their shrunken guys into your board, you have [Cyclonic Rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cyclonic Rift) or [Azorius Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azorius Charm) mana to remove their second-biggest threat, Tamiyo draws you a bunch of cards, and Jace gets to work going through your library. Or you roll them both up again and repeat until your opponent tears their scalp off. That's value, folks.

Fun times running this guy with Tamiyo, the Moon Sage. The obvious thing would be to turn 4 Jace turn 5 Tamiyo, but better than that seems to be turn 5 Tamiyo, turn 6 Jace. Or you roll them both up again and repeat until your opponent tears their scalp off. That's value, folks.

Posted By: Lyoncet (9/25/2012 9:07:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I don't understand why everyone is so adverse to Jace when its been almost 3 years since he's been part of a block. Really, the first 5 walker have all hit 3 versions and a 4th was only a matter of time. We also have 2 other mono blue walkers that aren't Jace too, so I don't get that complaint either. Also, complaining about him being mono blue in a gold set is like complaining that we had mono colored walkers in Shards. Has the ONE stupid version of Jace hurt people so much that they not just get sick whenever they see a new copy? I just don't get it.  
  
Anyway, the card itself is fine. Your opponent has some control over the -2 so it will never be back breaking and the +1 is only really good against token decks. His -8 will hardly ever be relevant.

posts.post_content: Severely underrated right now. Defends himself and you with his +1, digs pretty damn well for you with -2, and uses your opponent's deck against him with his -8, as well as fishing out your biggest bomb. Realistically, there is absolutely no way this should be under 4/5 right now.

Posted By: General_Naga (9/26/2012 3:56:33 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Great card. Took the mana cost of [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor) and splices it well with abilities that aren't broken as Hell. I'd like to emphasize the obvious nerfing of [Fact or Fiction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fact or Fiction). They acknowledge that Jace needs to be good but not incredible. Well costed but not broken for the cost. They took Jace Beleren (well costed), Jace, Memory Adept (powerful) and the cost of Jace, the Mind Sculptor (just as a tribute to the undisputed king), and spliced them well.  
But *terrible* art.  
5/5 though.
posts.html:

They took Jace Beleren (well costed), Jace, Memory Adept (powerful) and the cost of Jace, the Mind Sculptor (just as a tribute to the undisputed king), and spliced them well.
But terrible art.
5/5 though.
